snoopy.blindnote:
The sequence is increased based on snoRNABase.
(20100624末安)UCSCを参考にgenomic positionを変更した,NCBIを参考にaccession Noを加えた,evidenceはsnoRNAbaseのレファレンスから抜粋。 (20111201吉浜)ホスト遺伝子の塩基配列と構造をRPGを参考に変更しました。
snoopy.evidence: Ganot, P., Bortolin, M. L., and Kiss, T. (1997a). Site-specific pseudouridine formation in preribosomal RNA is guided by small nucleolar RNAs. Cell 89, 799-809, Ofengand, J., and Bakin, A. (1997). Mapping to nucleotide resolution of pseudouridine residues in large subunit ribosomal RNAs from representative eukaryotes, prokaryotes, archaebacteria, mitochondria and chloroplasts. J Mol Biol 266, 246-268, Ganot, P., Caizergues-Ferrer, M., and Kiss, T. (1997b). The family of box ACA small nucleolar RNAs is defined by an evolutionarily conserved secondary structure and ubiquitous sequence elements essential for RNA accumulation. Genes Dev 11, 941-956, Jin, H., Loria, J. P., and Moore, P. B. (2007). Solution structure of an rRNA substrate bound to the pseudouridylation pocket of a box H/ACA snoRNA. Mol Cell 26, 205-215, Wu, H., and Feigon, J. (2007). H/ACA small nucleolar RNA pseudouridylation pockets bind substrate RNA to form three-way junctions that position the target U for modification. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 104, 6655-6660.
